intro: Erica flexicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and other ericaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or white, appearing in dense clusters during the spring and summer months. Erica flexicaulis thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
